research_goal.title: Gene Transfer Mechanisms in CRISPR-Based Horizontal Gene Transfer
research_goal.description: Explain the mechanisms by which CRISPR-Cas systems facilitate horizontal gene transfer (HGT) between distantly related bacterial species. Focus on understanding how phage-inducible chromosomal islands (PICIs) exploit CRISPR machinery. Integrate molecular, evolutionary, and ecological perspectives.
constraints: Must integrate molecular and evolutionary mechanisms
Consider selective pressures and ecosystem effects

hypotheses.title: Hypothesis 1 (Literature-based): Microbiology/Molecular Evolution Mechanism
hypotheses.description: Generated from synthesizing literature on Microbiology/Molecular Evolution. This hypothesis proposes a novel mechanism integrating existing research.
hypotheses.mechanism: Building on current understanding of Microbiology/Molecular Evolution, this mechanism suggests that the key pathway involves cross-disciplinary integration of molecular and systems-level effects.
testable_predictions: Prediction 1: Observable effect in Microbiology/Molecular Evolution context
grounding_evidence: Wang et al. (2023) - Supporting pathway analysis
